showText: Thanks for all who came out to support Best Buddies!
It was a very fun event. We played in the back of the brewery and it was a cool environment!
8x10 shows always bring a different excitement level. Thanks to everyone who came out and made the night a blast!
Our first show of 2020 was a blast! Thanks to all who came out. It was packed upstairs and we loved everyone singing along.
showImgAlt: LFG guitarist and singer Nick Hermes

showText: Our first D.C. gig. Solly's is the spot! Great stage and sound system. And a great dance floor! Was poppin.
showImgAlt: Lies From Granny guitar player Kyle Fives

showText: Halloween songs at Mums, one of our favorite Baltimore spots.
showImgAlt: Lies From Granny bass player Ben Denissen
songs: I Put a Spell on You

showText: Outside venue in Baltimore. This was our third gig in 48 hours. What a weekend!
showImgAlt: Anna Stevens and Kyle Fives out front at Sandlot in Baltimore

showText: LFG's first show at the 8x10. It was a blast! 200+ attendance. Very grateful to play at such a cool venue.
showImgAlt: Kyle Fives and Anna Stevens rockin the 8x10 stage

showText: Our first festival. Beautiful day to play outside and to be a part of a great community event.
showImgAlt: The whole Lies From Granny gang at the Locust Point Festival

showText: Mums is a great party spot in Federal Hill, Baltimore. Cash encouraged!
showImgAlt: Colin Stevens drumming up a storm at an LFG show

showText: The first gig at Sandlot went so well they asked us back!
This was a Friday happy hour - gorgeous day with great tunes.
showImgAlt: Anna Stevens singing at the Sandlot in Baltimore

showText: This was our first show at Sandlot. It's an outdoor spot in Harbor East and is right on the water. It's hard to beat playing outside.
showImgAlt: Kyle Fives shredding the guitar at Sandlot in Baltimore
